task.title: Phase 1: Planning and setting up your environment

prolog.author: Anna van Raaphorst
Richard Johnson
prolog.publisher: OASIS (Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards)

keywords.indexterm: getting started with DITA Open Toolkit phase 1: planning and setting up your environment

step.cmd: Read the topics in Evaluating DITA and DITA Open Toolkit for suggestions on how to evaluate for use in your environment, and how to choose your initial pilot project.
Be sure your system environment meets the requirements in System requirements and supported applications.
Install and become familiar with the authoring tool you plan to use to create DITA content.
step.info: For information about choosing and installing an authoring tool, see topics in Installation overview.

step.cmd: Install DITA Open Toolkit and its prerequisite tools.
step.info: For an overview of the installation process, see Installation overview. Step-by-step installation instructions are in the same section.

step.cmd: Set up your DITA source file and processing (build) environments.
step.info: Information and instructions are in Setting up your working environment.
